trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Elastic Scale FAQ
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Elastic Scale FAQ

trans-unit.source: Frequently Asked Questions about Azure SQL Database Elastic Scale.
trans-unit.target: Frequently Asked Questions about Azure SQL Database Elastic Scale.

trans-unit.source: The schema info object is only used to split merge scenarios.
trans-unit.target: The schema info object is only used to split merge scenarios.

trans-unit.source: If an application is inherently single-tenant, then it does not require the Split Merge tool and thus there is no need to populate the schema info object.
trans-unit.target: If an application is inherently single-tenant, then it does not require the Split Merge tool and thus there is no need to populate the schema info object.

trans-unit.source: Please see [Adding a shard to an application using the elastic database client library](sql-database-elastic-scale-add-a-shard.md).
trans-unit.target: Please see [Adding a shard to an application using the elastic database client library](sql-database-elastic-scale-add-a-shard.md).

trans-unit.source: Using the elastic database client library does not incur any costs.
trans-unit.target: Using the elastic database client library does not incur any costs.

trans-unit.source: Costs accrue only for the Azure SQL databases that you use for shards and the Shard Map Manager, as well as the web/worker roles you provision for the Split Merge tool.
trans-unit.target: Costs accrue only for the Azure SQL databases that you use for shards and the Shard Map Manager, as well as the web/worker roles you provision for the Split Merge tool.

trans-unit.source: Do not use credentials in the form of “User ID=username@servername”, instead simply use “User ID = username”.
trans-unit.target: Do not use credentials in the form of “User ID=username@servername”, instead simply use “User ID = username”.

trans-unit.source: Also, be sure that the “username” login has permissions on the shard.
trans-unit.target: Also, be sure that the “username” login has permissions on the shard.

trans-unit.source: No—the creation of the Shard Map Manager (for example, [ShardMapManagerFactory.CreateSqlShardMapManager](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.azure.sqldatabase.elasticscale.shardmanagement.shardmapmanagerfactory.createsqlshardmapmanager.aspx)) is a one-time operation.
trans-unit.target: No—the creation of the Shard Map Manager (for example, [ShardMapManagerFactory.CreateSqlShardMapManager](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.azure.sqldatabase.elasticscale.shardmanagement.shardmapmanagerfactory.createsqlshardmapmanager.aspx)) is a one-time operation.

trans-unit.source: Your application should use the call [ShardMapManagerFactory.TryGetSqlShardMapManager()](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.azure.sqldatabase.elasticscale.shardmanagement.shardmapmanagerfactory.trygetsqlshardmapmanager.aspx) at application start-up time.
trans-unit.target: Your application should use the call [ShardMapManagerFactory.TryGetSqlShardMapManager()](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.azure.sqldatabase.elasticscale.shardmanagement.shardmapmanagerfactory.trygetsqlshardmapmanager.aspx) at application start-up time.

trans-unit.source: There should only one such call per application domain.
trans-unit.target: There should only one such call per application domain.

trans-unit.source: Please reach out to us on the <linkText>Azure SQL Database forum</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Please reach out to us on the <linkText>Azure SQL Database forum</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Elastic Scale APIs give you a connection to the correct database for your sharding key, but do not provide sharding key filtering.
trans-unit.target: The Elastic Scale APIs give you a connection to the correct database for your sharding key, but do not provide sharding key filtering.

trans-unit.source: Add WHERE clauses to your query to restrict the scope to the provided sharding key, if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Add WHERE clauses to your query to restrict the scope to the provided sharding key, if necessary.

trans-unit.source: Yes, a shard is an individual database, and thus one shard could be a Premium edition while another be a Standard edition.
trans-unit.target: Yes, a shard is an individual database, and thus one shard could be a Premium edition while another be a Standard edition.

trans-unit.source: Further, the edition of a shard can scale up or down multiple times during the lifetime of the shard.
trans-unit.target: Further, the edition of a shard can scale up or down multiple times during the lifetime of the shard.

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: For split operations, the target database must exist with the appropriate schema and be registered with the Shard Map Manager.
trans-unit.target: For split operations, the target database must exist with the appropriate schema and be registered with the Shard Map Manager.

trans-unit.source: For merge operations, you must delete the shard from the shard map manager and then delete the database.
trans-unit.target: For merge operations, you must delete the shard from the shard map manager and then delete the database.
